thread.title: Newnan, East Coweta win regular season finales
thread.title_full: Newnan, East Coweta win regular season finales

title: Newnan, East Coweta win regular season finales
text:
Newnan, East Coweta win regular season finales Friday, October 02, 2015 Comments 
Newnanâ€™s softball team improved its record to 15-9 overall and 6-2 in Region 3- with a 12-0 victory over Douglas County, while East Coweta improved its record to 26-2 with an 8-0 non-region win against McIntosh as both teams completed regular-season schedules. 
Newnan scored seven runs in the second and five in the third en route to its third straight shutout in a row. 
Hannah Scarbrough started the second-inning fireworks with a two-run triple and the Lady Cougars picked up a solid pitching performance from Addie Andrews, who gave up six hits, but struck out six and walked none. 
Andrews was coming off a no-hitter and it was her third shutout in a row. 
Offensively, Katelin Richadson and Danielle Curlee joined Scarbrough with two RBIs. Sarah Vallery, Leslie Davis, and Darby Kenne also added RBIs. 
EAST COWETA 8, MCINTOSH 0 : Morgan Goree, Rachel Vaughn and Kelley Lynch combined on a no-hitter en route to the Lady Lions victory. 
The three pitchers combined on nine strikeouts. 
The Lady Indians did their damage on just four hits, scoring two runs in the first, two in the second, one in the fourth and five in the fifth. 
Leadoff hitter Mekhia Freeman led the Lady Indians offense with a 2-for-4 performance with a triple and two RBIs. 
Dani Morgan, Lindsey Warren and Sheyenne Bell also added RBIs. More
